title: Looking for ideas.. trying to work on a fictional project
content:
Hi,

I'm trying to add pieces to my portfolio but I don't really have any idea. I'd like to edit a small book with images to show my illustration, design and typography capabilities but I just have no idea what to work on. If any of you have any idea of texts that would be nice to edit I'd be very interested.

Thanks a lot,

Pierre-Luc
author: Pierre-Luc Auclair

comments.content: Pierre, try working with a work that is in Public Domain. I suggest Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Its abstract enough for you to go wild with your creative imagination and create a new spin on an old look.

You might even try a long poem such as T.S. Eliot's "The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufock," or a series of shorter, concise poems like hiakus or something. If it's portfolio work, you probably don't have to choose something in public domain, but the comment above is a good one. If you plan to reproduce the work, publish it on the internet or sell the work in any way, be very careful of copyright laws. You might read [10 myths about copyright explained](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014054947/http:/www.templetons.com/brad/copymyths.html) by Brad Templeton.

ChuckGroth
